page.title: 09Transport Survey
page.content: A Survey was undertaken amongst the residents of Clive who were asked to describe what mode of transport they used to travel. Most households owned a{car}and many owned more than one, the exceptions being amongst the older residents. Cars were used for journeys to work, for shopping, entertainment, sports, taking children to school and the like. There is one {bus service}which stops at Clive 3 times a day on its way from Shrewsbury to Wem. A{train service operates from Shrewsbury to Crewe and stops infrequently at Wem and Yorton which is about half a mile from Clive and outside this D block. Motor bikes , mopeds and bicycles are used mostly by the younger members of the community for travelling around the local area.
